title.narrative: UNCDF - Local Government and Climate Change 2016-2018

description.narrative: The programme's main goal is reduced vulnerability to climate change impacts of people and critical systems (natural and societal) in the most vulnerable rural Districts of Cambodia. Four outcomes have been identified to contribute to the goal: -Vulnerable communities are supported to plan and implement investments for climate change adaptation in eight districts.-Capacity development approach for sub-national climate change mainstreaming is demonstrated as effective. -Effectiveness of local government action on climate change is demonstrated and a range of possible interventions are expanded.-Finance is mobilised and systems (planning, financing, implementation and performance assessment) is ready for scale up. The Programme intended to pilot options for channeling of global climate funds to be used when Cambodia had become accredited.
The third phase of support to strengthen climate change adaption within the local developments plans and investments.

UNCDF inkom den 19 april 2016 med ansökan "Local Government and Climate Change-2", fas 3. Till följd av dialog kring ansökan inkom UNCDF med ett reviderat programförslag och resultatramverk den 4 november 2016. Insatsen som avses genomföras är del i ett globalt program för lokala myndigheters anpassning till klimatförändringar, LoCAL (Local Climate Adaptive Living). Programmet i Kambodja, "Local Governments and Climate Change" (LGCC), som är ett av LoCALs första nationella program, etablerades 2011 genom stöd från Cambodia Climate Change Alliance Trust Fund, vilken Sida stödjer.
Programmet syftar till att etablera metoder och verktyg för lokala myndigheter så att dessa kan integrera klimatfrågor i utvecklingsplanering, budgetering och genomförande. Genom insatsen stärks således lokala myndigheters förmåga att integrera klimatanpassning i lokala utvecklingsplaner och investeringar. Sida gav direktfinansiering till den andra fasen av LGCC (2012-juni 2016), med ett totalt belopp om 12,5 MSEK, vilket medgav en utökning av kapacitets- och metodutveckling, samt en utökning av klimatresilienta utvecklingsprojekt.
Den tredje fasen bidrar till fortsatt kapacitets- och metodutveckling för lokala myndigheter, samt klimatresilienta utvecklingssatsningar. Satsningarna genomförs i åtta distrikt i två provinser, Takao och Battambang. I tillägg bistår programmet med att stödja nationella genomförandeaktörer att - genom National Committe for Sub-National Democratic Development Secretariat, NCDD-S - direkt mobilisera programbaserade globala och lokala klimatresurser från bland annat den Globala Klimatfonden.
Det totala beloppet för programmet uppgår till drygt 1,5 miljoner USD, motsvarande ca 13,9 miljoner kronor, varav 12 miljoner kronor efterfrågas från Sida.

description.narrative: The conclusion report is based on the Annual progress report (received 20190513) and consolidated Interrim Statemnts of Accounts 2018 (received 20190705) and the Final report coveriong the entire Bridging Phase 2017-2019 including workplan and budget 2019, the combined Financial Reporting period July 2016-October 2019 and the Interim Statements of Accounts 6 December 2016 to 30 June 2019 (received 20191220). The final certified Statement of Accounts are due 20200630, they are, however, not expected to differ from the interim ones provided end of 2019. No funds remain to be returned from the programme. The contribution will be closed once the final certified Statement of Accounts is received and approved. Main contact persons at UNCDF are: Fakri Karim (based in Bangkok), fakri.karim@uncdf.org, and Kosal Sar (based in PP), kosal.sar@uncdf.org. Regular exchanges with Mari Albihn and Ola Sahlen were held about the contribution from the onset and during the activity period. Sweden has supported UNCDF and its LOCAL programme in Cambodia, (Local Government and Climate Change programme (LGCC) since 2011. A bridging phase was originally planned for 2017-2018 but delays resulted in a no-cost extension to 30 June 2019. By the end of the no-cost extension all Performance Based Climate Resilience Grants (PBCRG) sub-project activities were completed. An Annual Performance Assessment was conducted by UNCDF in April 2019. By the end 2017, only 5 out of 54 sub-projects had been implemented. In March 2018 UNCDF has provided updated information, and due to an acceleration in the implementation and an earlier disbursement of Swedish funds in 2018, UNCDF expected that the projects would be implemented on time. The main delays consist of the NCDD-s accreditation process as a National Implementing Entity (NIE)to the Green Climate Fund (GCF). The accreditation is not yet finalised. By the end of the Bridging Phase the following main target results were achieved: Outcome 1 Vulnerable Communities supported to plan and implement investment for climate change adaptation in eight districts90 sub-projects were funded including 53 climate-resilient rural roads, 15 small irrigation schemes, four domestic water supply projects, two flood protection facilities, two health facilities in flooding areas and 14 non-infrastructure activities. The total reported number of beneficiaries is 320,934 of whom 51% are women and approximately 33% are from households holding ID-Poor cards. The average technical score was 80%. The sustainability of the sub-projects is 65%. The main target results were achieved. Outcome 2 Capacity Development Approach for sub-national climate change mainstreaming is demonstrated as effectiveNational Committee for Sub-National Democratic Development Secretariat (NCDD-S) developed a climate change adaptation course for sub-national administration (SNA) and SNA officials in 39 districts out of planned 30 districts have received training, i.e. the main target was achieved Outcome 3 Finance mobilised and systems (planning, financing implementation and performance assessment) ready for scale upThe key target was the accreditation of NCDD as a NIE to the GCF. The accreditation process is not finalised. Outcome 4 Effectiveness of local Government action on climate change demonstrated and range of possible interventions expandedA methodology for climate- adaptive cost-benefit analysis has been developed but not implemented. Annual progress report (received 20190513) and consolidated Interim Statements of Accounts 2018 (received 20190705) and the Final report covering the entire Bridging Phase 2017-2019 including workplan and budget 2019, the combined Financial Reporting period July 2016-October 2019 and the Interim Statements of Accounts 6 December 2016 to 30 June 2019 (received 20191220) are hereby approved.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
